node.title: How No Time To Die could hint towards the next James Bond
node.description: The final James Bond film starring Daniel Craig as 007 comes out this week, endingÂ one era and raising questions about where the franchise goes from here.
node.content:
["The final James Bond film starring Daniel Craig as 007 comes out this week, ending one era and raising questions about where the franchise goes from here.", "Craig, 53, has starred in five James Bond films, evolving the famous character with\u00a0each performance.", "However, while his tenure as 007 comes to an end with No Time To Die, there is speculation as to who will be the next James Bond.", "No announcement has been made, although rumour mills have been in overdrive since Craig announced the latest film would be his last.", "The evolution of Bond under Craig and the growing importance of\u00a0female characters may hint at the direction the franchise will take going forward.", "
Female characters to play a greater role
", "James Bond's world appears to be more diverse and focuses\u00a0on a raft of characters from different backgrounds.", "The old style of James Bond, the hard-nosed British man who is irresistible to women, has been slowly phased out under Craig, according to producer Barbara Broccoli.", "\"Daniel completely transformed the character for the 21st century,\" she told ABC News Breakfast.", "\"He made him very real. He brought humanity to the character.", "\"What he has done is he has let people into the emotional life of Bond, the inner conflicts.", "", "
Daniel Craig plays James Bond in five films for the franchise.(Getty: Greg Williams)
", "This \"epic conclusion\" will have a major focus on the film's female characters.", "L\u00e9a Seydoux, Lashana Lynch and Judy Dench head a diverse female contingent who have a major impact on the storyline of No Time To Die.", "Film director Cary Joji Fukunaga told News Breakfast that Craig's run as James Bond has allowed the franchise to branch out and bring more compelling characters to the story.", "\"The women in this\u00a0film are real people, real characters that have agency and are\u00a0making decisions that have a direct impact on the outcome of the story and aren't just props,\" he said.", "This was a sentiment echoed by Lynch, who plays\u00a0Nomi in No Time To Die, saying the latest film allows each female character to grow and leave their own mark on the story.", "\"I think we have an array of women who have different roles, different backgrounds, different cultures that are all intertwined,\" she said.", "", "
Lashana Lynch says the female characters in No Time TO Die will play a major role.(IMDB)
", "
Who is the next James Bond?
", "That is the question fans of the film series are asking.", "While we do not know who will be the next Bond, we do have an idea of where the franchise is heading.\u00a0", "The diverse world that James Bond represents in the 21st Century on film is going to be replicated in a series of new novels, announced last week.", "English writer Kim Sherwood will become the first female 007 author with three novels announced by Ian Fleming Publications on November 4.", "The books are set in a world where Bond is missing, presumed dead, with a new generation of Double O agents.", "While there has been no hint as to what backgrounds the new spies have, the novels will have a heavy focus on the characters of M, played by Dench for several movies, and Moneypenny.", "But Bond is expected to return at some point and the focus on characters away from the norm\u00a0may be reflected on the big screen.", "Names including Idris Elba, Rege-Jean Page and even Lashana Lynch have been touted as possible new Bonds, all a far cry from tradition.", "Broccoli has repeatedly said that the next 007 \"doesn't need to be a white man\", which has given oxygen to these potential picks.", "But there are others who fit the traditional mould, with Tom Hardy and Tom Holland both being considered good chances for the role.", "Their previous work would point to the continued development of the Bond character, which Craig has nurtured for his five films."]
